questions.question: $$ \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} = a \frac{\partial u}{\partial t} $$ $$ \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} = 3 \frac{\partial u}{\partial t} $$ $$ when\ u(0,t)=0,\ u(4,t)=0,\ u(x,0)=x(4-x) $$ $$ h = 1 $$ $$ \lambda = 0.25 $$ Find the distribution of u at x=1 and t = 0.75

$$ \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} = a \frac{\partial u}{\partial t} $$ $$ \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} = 4 \frac{\partial u}{\partial t} $$ $$ when\ u(0,t)=0,\ u(4,t)=0,\ u(x,0)=x(4-x) $$ $$ h = 1 $$ $$ \lambda = 0.25 $$ Find the distribution of u at x=2 and t = 1
